title: Prince William's Team Reportedly Made Demands for His Upcoming Reunion With Prince Harry To Prove His 'Hierarchy'
description: Prince William and Prince Harry are reportedly preparing to cross paths at their cousin’s upcoming wedding and are putting plans in place to avoid any interactions. Peter Phillips, the son of Princess Anne, announced to Hello that he is engaged to partner Harriet Sperling. While wedding plans were not revealed, sources are already speculating about …
content:
Prince William and Prince Harry are reportedly preparing to cross paths at their cousin’s upcoming wedding and are putting plans in place to avoid any interactions.

Peter Phillips, the son of Princess Anne, announced to Hello that he is engaged to partner Harriet Sperling. While wedding plans were not revealed, sources are already speculating about what this could mean for estranged members of the Royal Family, namely Prince Harry and Prince William.
• None Experts Reveal What Prince Archie's Latest Endeavor Says About His Budding Personality

A source from the palace exclusively told Rob Shuter’s #ShuterScoop that Harry and William’s camps have already laid out some demands.

“The feud is still active and raw,” the insider said. “They made it clear: no photos, no interactions, and absolutely no sitting next to one another.”

According to sources, William’s team is pushing for the future king to receive a top-tier place at the ceremony. “They insisted his seat reflect his future role as king,” one source explained. “And that means Harry’s position must be visibly beneath his. They don’t even try to hide the hierarchy anymore.”

In return, Harry’s team is requesting separate arrival times, private security, and insists that he won’t appear in any official portraits with his estranged older brother. “He doesn’t want to be part of some fake PR reunion,” claims a source close to Harry. “He’s not interested in pretending things are fine when they’re not.”

“They’ll be in the same room—but not in the same frame,” a family source said. “No speeches, no toasts, no warm moments. Just frost.”

The brothers both have a close relationship with their older cousin, who has been somewhat of an older brother figure to them. Long before their feud, Harry and William attended his 2008 wedding to Autumn Kelly, from whom he split in 2019.

However, amid their ongoing feud, Harry and William have gone to great lengths to avoid one another. In August 2024, they both attended the funeral of their uncle, Lord Robert Fellowes, but did not interact.

Recently, royal insiders have speculated whether King Charles and Harry’s teams being in contact with one another could bring a feud between the brothers to an end. “I think that Harry’s relationship with his brother is a different beast than his relationship with his father,” royal expert Kristen Meinzer told Us Weekly. “But perhaps if Charles warms more to Harry, William will feel compelled to follow his lead.”

Before you go, click here to see the best photos of Princess Diana playing with William and Harry.
• None A Look Back at Martha Stewart's Incredible Life, From Her Early Modeling Career to Her Media Empire at 84
• None Join These 10 Celebrity Book Clubs & Read Along with Your Favorite Stars

Sign up for SheKnows' Newsletter. For the latest news, follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
summary: Prince William and Prince Harry are reportedly preparing to reunite at their cousin's upcoming wedding, with their teams planning to avoid any interactions. A source from the palace has stated that their demands for this are clear: no photos, no interactions, and no sitting next to each other. William's team is pushing for a top-tier place at the ceremony, reflecting his future role as king, and Harry's request for separate arrival times, private security, and he will not appear in any official portraits with his estranged brother. The brothers have a close relationship with their older cousin, Prince Harry, who has been an older brother figure to them. Despite their ongoing feud, they have gone to great lengths to avoid each other at their uncle's funeral.
shortSummary: Prince William's team demands a pre-wedding reunion with Prince Harry to prove his hierarchy and prove his position at his cousin’s wedding.

scraped_sources.text:
EXCLUSIVE: PRINCE WILLIAM AND PRINCE HARRY REFUSE TO SIT TOGETHER AT FAMILY WEDDING
PLUS: JUSTIN BIEBER SLAMMED FOR USING BABY TO SAVE FLOP ALBUM — LINDSAY LOHAN’S CAREER HINGES ON ‘FREAKIER FRIDAY’ COMEBACK
EXCLUSIVE: PRINCE HARRY & PRINCE WILLIAM’S FEUD HITS NEW LOW — REFUSE TO SIT TOGETHER AT FAMILY WEDDING
Separate arrivals. Separate seating. Separate lives.
The royal family’s ongoing cold war is about to steal the spotlight at what should have been a joyful event.
#ShuterScoop has exclusively learned that Prince William and Prince Harry will both attend cousin Peter Phillips’ upcoming wedding—but have each issued strict demands to ensure they remain as far apart as possible.
“The feud is still active and raw,” says a senior palace insider. “They made it clear: no photos, no interactions, and absolutely no sitting next to one another.”
According to sources, William’s team pushed for top-tier placement at the ceremony. “They insisted his seat reflect his future role as king,” one source explains. “And that means Harry’s position must be visibly beneath his. They don’t even try to hide the hierarchy anymore.”
Harry’s camp, in turn, has requested separate arrival times, private security, and a firm ban on appearing in any official portraits with William. “He doesn’t want to be part of some fake PR reunion,” says a source close to Harry. “He’s not interested in pretending things are fine when they’re not.”
Even the reception has been meticulously orchestrated to avoid spontaneous run-ins. “They’ll be in the same room—but not in the same frame,” one family source says. “No speeches, no toasts, no warm moments. Just frost.”
Peter Phillips had hoped the wedding would be a family reset. “He wanted a day of celebration, not tension,” says a friend of the groom. “But instead, everyone’s walking on eggshells.”
This isn’t a reunion. It’s a royal standoff in formalwear.
EXCLUSIVE: JUSTIN BIEBER BLASTED FOR USING BABY SON TO SAVE HIS FLOP ALBUM
“This isn’t fatherhood. It’s a marketing stunt.”
Justin Bieber is facing a wave of backlash after placing his newborn son front and center in the music video for his underperforming single “Yukon.”
The track, from his troubled comeback album Swag, has failed to chart meaningfully—and now sources say Justin’s team is “in meltdown mode,” using baby Jack in a last-ditch effort to stir sympathy and clicks.
“The video isn’t a tribute to fatherhood. It’s damage control,” says a source close to production. “The baby’s inclusion was strategic. They’re trying to save a flop.”
In the video, Bieber—shirtless and emotional—sings on a yacht while his son floats on a tiny raft and is cradled in several carefully lit scenes. Fans and industry insiders alike are calling it out.
“This isn’t about love. It’s about optics,” says one critic. “He promised to protect that child’s privacy. Now the kid’s being used to sell downloads.”
The controversy comes as Swag continues to sink, with fewer than 300,000 total streams and no tour or physical release date. “They’re out of tricks,” the source adds. “This was the Hail Mary—and they used a baby to throw it.”
EXCLUSIVE: LINDSAY LOHAN’S CAREER HANGS IN THE BALANCE — ‘FREAKIER FRIDAY’ IS HER LAST SHOT
If this bombs, she’s headed straight back to made-for-TV Christmas hell.
Lindsay Lohan’s big comeback is riding on a single movie—and insiders say the pressure has never been higher.
Disney’s Freakier Friday sees Lohan reuniting with Jamie Lee Curtis in a sequel nearly two decades in the making. But this time, she’s playing the mom—and the stakes are very real.
“This isn’t just another role,” says a source close to the production. “This is the last shot at a Hollywood return. If it doesn’t hit, she’s done.”
Lohan has gone all in—taking acting classes, hiring media coaches, even overhauling her image. Critics who’ve seen early cuts say she gives a strong performance, but the film itself has a nostalgia problem.
“It leans too heavily on the original,” one reviewer says. “It’s fun, but thin. She’s the best thing in it—but that may not be enough.”
Box office numbers will tell the real story. “There’s no next opportunity lined up,” says an insider. “If audiences don’t show up, she’ll be back making holiday movies on Hallmark channel.”
EXCLUSIVE: JENNIFER ANISTON’S NEW MAN HAS A DISABILITY — AND SHE DOESN’T CARE WHAT YOU THINK
He walks with a limp. She walks beside him. That’s all that matters.
Jim Curtis, Jennifer Aniston’s new boyfriend, isn’t the Hollywood prototype. He walks with a noticeable limp due to a serious spinal condition. And now that paparazzi photos have made that detail public, the world is watching with judgment instead of understanding.
“It’s disgusting how quickly people go from curious to cruel,” says a source close to the actress. “Jennifer doesn’t care about the limp. She cares about the man.”
Curtis, a former Wall Street star turned motivational speaker, has built a second act based on resilience and integrity. Friends describe him as “brilliant, grounded, and incredibly kind.”
Still, online speculation has been rampant. Some claim Jennifer is dating “beneath her level.” Others question if Curtis can “keep up.”
“People still treat disability like a punchline,” the source says. “But Jennifer’s not here for anyone’s ignorance.”
The message is clear: Curtis walks differently—but with strength. And Jennifer Aniston is proud to walk beside him.
#ShuterScoop

When Prince Harry turned 36 in 2020, it was an equally celebratory and reflective moment for the newly independent royal. At age 36, his beloved mother Princess Diana died in a tragic car accident involving paparazzi, taking her from young sons Prince William and Harry far too soon. A doting mother, Diana was often seen bonding with young William and Harry, her two beloved boys with Prince Charles, and while Diana’s time as a royal may have been complicated, marked by media scandals and her ultimate divorce from Charles in 1996, her legacy as a mother is not. On this day, we’re honoring Diana’s best moments as a mom, as Harry will always remember her: from ski trips to water slides, first days of school, and more photos of Diana and the boys that we’ll never forget.
From his decision to step back from the royal family with Meghan Markle to his dedication to carrying on her charity work in Lesotho and beyond, it’s clear how much Harry has been influenced by Diana’s own path as a royal. And as he and William have taken on fatherhood, they’ve only been more reminded of aspects of their childhood with Diana that they’d like to carry on.
For William, that’s meant raising George, Charlotte, and Louis in Kensington Palace, where he and young Harry grew up with Diana, while for Harry, that’s meant raising Archie out of the public eye and giving him as much normalcy as possible, another goal of Diana’s throughout. Looking back on these photos of the three of them, we know Diana would be so proud of both her boys — and hope that, no matter what their differences, they’ll always find their way back to this close bond as brothers.
Harry and William have have, in many ways, devoted their legacies to ensuring Diana’s effect on the royal family would not be forgotten. These photos will remind you just how close Diana was with both her boys — we recommend getting out the tissues now.
A version of this article was originally published in August 2020.
-
Diana With Harry & William & Their Friends at Necker Island
This snapshot of Diana being buried in the sand by her sons Prince William and Prince Harry, along with their friends at Necker Island is the sweetest moment we’ve ever seen!
-
Diana & Harry Chilling at Highgrove House
Princess Diana was so happy while holding onto Prince Harry at their country home in Highgrove.
-
Skiing Mother-Son Trio
When Princess Diana was around her kids, it was all smiles, especially during this skiiing trip to Austria in 1993.
-
Diana & William Walk Home From Lunch
This 1997 pic was taken just 10 days before Diana’s tragic accident. She and 15-year-old William share a laugh on their walk home from a Chelsea restaurant.
-
Family Outing to Head of State Ceremony
Diana leans over to talk to her boys in this 1995 photo. We’re very curious what Harry’s grinning about on the right!
-
Diana & the Boys at Twickenham
This 1995 photo shows Diana and her two boys at Twickenham, a suburb of London.
-
Diana Drops the Boys at School
Though Diana and Charles had separated by this point, they still got together for the boys’ big days.
-
Royal Family Portrait
One of the few royal family portraits featuring this particular group, the photo shows William front and center, with mom Diana and brother Harry to the left.
-
William Signs the Eton Register
In 1995, William signed the register at Eton College, while proud parents Diana and Charles looked on. Harry rounds out the crew in a sweet suit and tie.
-
Diana Takes Her Boys to the Royal Tournament
This 1995 snap features William, Harry and an unnamed friend of Harry’s — along with a watchful (and very chic!) Diana to the left.
-
Diana & the Boys on a Ride at Alton Towers
More rides for Diana, William and Harry! This time, Diana had their friends come along for a ride at Alton Towers.
-
William’s First Day of School!
In 1995, William began at Eton College. This family photo was taken one day before his tenure at the school began.
-
Diana Celebrates V-J Day with William & Harry
This 1995 photo shows Diana with her two sons at the Queen Victoria Memorial. And Harry appears to be getting a bit antsy about the time!
-
Greeting the Public in Norfolk
This 1994 photo shows the royal family strolling past the public in Sandringham. We’re loving Diana’s hat, and look! William’s growing up so quickly…
-
Queen Elizabeth Takes Diana & William For a Ride
On William’s carriage ride with the Queen, we see a young Royal Majesty perfecting a graceful wave while the future king looks bashfully on.
-
Diana & Harry at the British Grand Prix
Even with sunglasses, you can see the love in Diana’s eyes in this 1994 photo. And Harry seems to be having an excellent time at the Grand Prix.
-
Wedding Rehearsal Time!
This 1989 snap shows Diana leading Harry and William to rehearsals for the wedding between Charles Spencer and Victoria Lockwood.
-
The Water Rides Continue!
It’s not just Harry who loves a water park! William gets in on the fun of this log ride too, and it looks like the whole family can’t help but grin.
-
Horse-Drawn Carriage Through Austria
Diana and her boys continue the Austria ski vacation with a horse-drawn carriage — and Diana and Will share a sweet look.
-
Family Ski Trip to Austria
Have we mentioned that they love to ski? Diana rests with her bundled-up boys on a skiing holiday in Austria, 1993.
-
Diana & Harry Go Down a Water Slide
Young Harry loved a good waterpark — and we know this because there are so many photos of the very game Diana hopping on a ride with him.
-
A Royal Trip to Windsor
This 1992 snap shows William and Harry all dressed up (if looking quite shy!) at Windsor. Diana is grinning down at her youngest.
-
Diana & Harry at Thorpe Park
This 1992 photo shows Diana placing a hand on Harry’s shoulder (then age 8). Diana’s smile and Harry’s copper hair are our favorite parts of this scene.
-
Diana & the Boys See a Rugby Match
Doesn’t that look on Diana’s face just melt your heart? This 1992 photo shows a family outing to the Wales v. France Rugby Union match.
-
Diana & Her Boys Hit the Slopes!
Diana loved to ski, and taught her boys from a young age. This 1991 photo shows Di and her boys riding up a chair lift.
-
Royal Family Waves Goodbye to Toronto
All aboard the Yacht Britannia! This 1991 photo shows Charles, Diana, William and Harry waving goodbye as they leave Toronto.
-
Diana & William at the International Horse Show
This 1990 Pic shows 8-year-old Wiliam touching mom Diana’s face, and it’s unbelievably sweet.
-
Diana Brings the Boys to the Queen’s Medical Center
This 1990 photo shows Diana, William and Harry heading into the Queen’s Medical Center to visit dad Charles, who injured his arm in a polo accident.
-
Carriage Ride with the Queen
Once again, these photos are giving us major 2019 vibes, given how similar the pics of Meghan Markle at this year’s event were. But how adorable is Harry’s little wave?
-
Young William & Harry at Trooping the Color
Remind you of anything? Perhaps these now-famous 2019 Trooping the Color photos of Prince Louis? Here’s the 1989 version, featuring all the same royals (for the most part), but 20 years younger.
-
Family Bike Ride!
This 1989 snap shows the family on vacation once again, this time in the Scilly Isles.
-
Harry Gets Wacky at Trooping the Color
The 1988 Trooping the Color shows Prince Harry getting a little goofy — and mom Diana appears to be having a stern word! We’re seeing a lot of resemblance between young Harry and young Princess Charlotte…
-
Harry & William Meet Their Baby Cousin Princess Beatrice
In 1988, Diana took her sons to the hospital to meet their newborn cousin: Princess Beatrice.
-
Harry & Will Play Dress-Up!
This adorable 1987 pic documents a stop at the British Transport Police — where Harry and William were clearly swiftly outfitted with helmets.
-
Harry Is Wowed by Trooping the Color
Little Harry is only 2 years old at the 1986 Trooping the Color, and while William waves confidently, Harry seems downright overwhelmed.
-
Diana & Her Boys Venture Out
On that same holiday in Majorca, Diana posed with her two boys on the steps — and it looks like the heat is getting to young Will.
-
Harry & William Rock Their Best Outfits Yet
Another photo from this 1987 Mallorca trip has us enraptured with Harry and William’s vacation style. Those overalls!!!
-
Harry & William Make a New Dog Friend
The Prince and Princess of Wales would often vacation alongside Diana, Charles, and the boys — but it looks like Harry is too enamored with his furry friend to notice.
-
Princess Diana Cuddles Prince Harry
One of the sweetest, and arguably best known photos of Princess Diana and Prince Harry, is this snapshot of the Princess of Wales cuddling her little boy during their trip to Majorca.
-
The Royal Family Takes Majorca
Harry is still so very tiny in this 1986 photo, which pictures the whole family at Maribend Palace in Spain.
-
Yacht Trip to Venice
In 1985, the family took a trip to Venice on the Royal Yacht Britannia. And it looks like Diana is loving young Will’s antics.
-
Diana & the Family Welcome Baby Harry
This 1984 snap shows newborn Harry posing with the rest of his family for this official royal photo.
-
Baby William Is Six Months Old
This 1982 photo shows William when he was just a bouncing baby boy.
-
St. Paul’s Cathedral
Diana’s two young sons wore their sharpest suits for this outing to St. Paul’s Cathedral.
-
‘Hook’ Premiere
With all those cameras snapping, Diana and her boys still look in their own little world.
-
Prince Harry Arrives To School
Upon arriving to school, Prince Harry was more than ready to make introductions to his new teacher. His mother, Princess Diana, couldn’t help but smile while watching her son reach out his hand.
-
Prince Harry On His First Day Of School
In this photo from September 1987, Princess Diana leads Prince Harry, who was only 3 years old, by the hand to his first day at a kindergarten in Notting Hill. Prince Charles was there too, holding Prince William’s hand as they saw Harry off.
-
Diana Goes In For A Hug
Princess Diana was always so affectionate with her two boys. In this photo, the late Princess of Wales is reunited with Prince William, center, and Harry, right, as she arrives aboard HMS Brittania in Toronto Harbor on Oct. 25, 1991.
-
Harry, William, & Diana Take A Boat Ride
Back in October 1991, Princess Diana took sons Harry and William on a ride with the Maid of Mist in Niagara Falls. Both young Princes were under the age of 10 at this time.

Prince Harry’s Feud With Prince William Is a ‘Different Beast’ Than With His Father, Royal Expert Says
Prince Harry’s ongoing feud with his brother, Prince William, is a far different animal than his rift with his father, King Charles.
“I think that Harry’s relationship with his brother is a different beast than his relationship with his father,” royal expert Kristen Meinzer exclusively tells Us Weekly. “But perhaps if Charles warms more to Harry, William will feel compelled to follow his lead.”
The Duke of Sussex’s fallout with his brother and father hit a fever pitch in 2020, when Harry and his wife, Meghan Markle, stepped away from their duties as senior members of the royal family. After the pair relocated across the pond in Montecito, California, Prince Harry published a tell-all memoir, Spare, reportedly further angering members of his family.
After losing his U.K. security protection, Prince Harry has been vocal about his rift with his father, particularly after the King of England’s cancer diagnosis.
“There have been so many disagreements between myself and some of my family,” Harry told the BBC in a tell-all interview shortly after he lost a legal battle to regain his U.K. security, adding that “it would be nice to reconcile” but that his father “won’t speak to me.”
The Duke of Sussex later claimed that his father could reinstate his security protection if he chose to do so.
“There is a lot of control and ability in my father’s hands,” Harry alleged. “Ultimately, this whole thing could be resolved through him. Not necessarily by intervening, but by stepping aside, allowing the experts [to] do what is necessary.”
King Charles, however, has remained tight-lipped regarding his fractured relationship with his son.
“It really does look like Charles is taking the ‘Keep Calm and Carry On’ axiom to a whole other level, doesn’t it?” Christopher Anderson, author of numerous books about the royal family, told Us in May. “The King is only hewing to a long-standing royal practice of not dignifying something by commenting on it. The Palace does not want to give oxygen to Harry’s remarks. King Charles has a lot on his plate as it is — there is no upside to his getting into a public quarrel with his son.”
As for his relationship with his brother, a source told Us that Prince William is “done” with his younger brother.
“William doesn’t talk about Harry anymore,” the insider exclusively revealed. “Everyone knows it’s a subject that they shouldn’t bring up, so he hasn’t brought up the interview and won’t.”
The source added, “William is done with Harry. When he becomes King, everybody thinks the divide will become even wider.”
Prince William and Prince Harry’s Royal Rift: ‘There’s No Turning Back’
Dr. Gail Saltz, a mental health professional, told Us that same month that the rift within the royal family is “a tragedy,” especially because “public perception” has taken “precedence over the private relationship.”
“Harry and William are the only brothers they’ll ever have," Saltz said. "Charles is the only father Harry will ever have. These are essential human relationships.”
She continued, “There are two different relationship lines here. There’s the public one because they are a working family, a royal family with a historical and tabloid place. And then there’s the private family relationship.”
In an apparent effort to mend his fractured relationships with members of the monarchy, Prince Harry recently shared his schedule with his father — an attempt to ensure none of his high-profile visits overshadow the royal family.
“I think any communication is good,” Meinzer exclusively tells Us. “It shows that things have not completely broken down between father and son, and that Harry, in particular, wants to mend fences.”

Peter Phillips and Harriet Sperling have confirmed their engagement after a year of dating. The couple shared their news on Friday exclusively with HELLO! and released two photos which showed off Harriet's stunning engagement ring.
A statement issued for the couple by Gerard Franklin, read: "Mr Peter Phillips, the son of HRH The Princess Royal and Captain Mark Phillips and Ms Harriet Sperling, daughter of the late Mr Rupert Sanders and Mrs Mary Sanders of Gloucestershire, have today confirmed their official engagement.
"Both families were informed jointly of the announcement and were delighted with the wonderful news of their engagement. Their Majesties The King and Queen, The Prince and Princess of Wales have been informed of the announcement. No date has been officially set for the wedding."
Harriet looked gorgeous in the photo, wearing a frilly white top and skirt, while her diamond ring sparkled as she proudly showed it off. She gazed lovingly at her husband-to-be, who wore a plaid top for the occasion.
HELLO's royal editor, Emily Nash, said: "This is wonderful news for Peter and Harriet, but also the wider royal family. Peter is close to the King and to his cousins and Harriet seems to have been warmly welcomed into the fold."
Meanwhile, royal photographer James Whatling, who has photographed Peter and Harriet several times, tells HELLO!: "We were waiting for this news. You can't watch this couple for too long without noticing how close they are, they’re so tactile and they're clearly so in love. It was only a matter of time."
Dating history
Peter, who is the eldest child of Princess Anne, is believed to have started dating Harriet in 2024. The couple reportedly met at a sporting event.
The pair made their debut at the Badminton Horse Trials in May 2024, and they were seen walking hand-in-hand as they supported Peter's sister, Zara Tindall. At the time, a friend of Peter's said the royal has met someone "recently" and they are "spending time together", but it's too early to be anything more at this stage.
At Royal Ascot the following month, she met Peter's uncle, King Charles. Harriet, who is an NHS paediatrician and freelance writer, was seen drinking champagne with the monarch and Queen Camilla, clearly making a good impression on Peter's relatives.
Harriet continued making appearances with her beau, including at separate sporting events and a soiree thrown by Camilla's son, Tom Parker Bowles.
Previous relationships
Before meeting Harriet, Peter was married to Autumn Kelly, and the former couple share two daughters, Savannah and Isla. After marrying in 2008, Peter and Autumn confirmed their separation in February 2020, with their divorce settled in June 2021. It's understood that Autumn remained living in Gloucestershire, so that she and Peter can co-parent their daughters.
Harriet is also a mother to daughter Georgia, and she previously addressed the issues of being a single mother. "In the earlier years of my journey as a single mother to my daughter, resources were scarce, and the future was uncertain," she told Woman Alive.
"Yet, in the absence of material security, I discovered the strength and life that comes from true selfless love. A love that is able to be solely devoted to your child."
Harriet's style file
Since making her public debut with Peter, Harriet has proven she fits right in with the royal ladies. Often flying the flag for British labels such as Beulah London, ME+EM and Penelope Chilvers, all eyes will be on the bride-to-be in the run up to her nuptials.
HELLO!'s Royal Correspondent Danielle Stacey says: "Harriet's style is effortless but chic, from A-line summer frocks to printed tea dresses, she hasn't missed the mark and always dresses appropriately for the occasion.
"Some fashion watchers have even predicted that we're already starting to see the 'Harriet-effect,' with pieces she's coveted selling out fast.
"Thinking ahead to her wedding day, I'm certain she will choose a quintessentially British designer, perhaps someone up-and-coming and local to Gloucestershire."

argos_summary: Prince William and Prince Harry are reportedly making arrangements to avoid interactions at their cousin Peter Phillips' upcoming wedding, amid their ongoing feud. Both camps have issued strict demands, including separate arrival times and seating arrangements that reflect their royal hierarchy. Sources indicate that the brothers will be in the same venue but will not engage with each other, highlighting the continued tension within the royal family.
